content:
<SamWilsn> > <SamWilsn>  Might bear repeating on https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-2294-explicit-bound-to-chain-id/11090 (re @eth1x_bridge_bot: <meridian (Sam Bacha)> [reply]: The value used for metamask is 

MAX_SAFE_CHAIN_ID = floor( ( 2**53 - 39 ) / 2 ) = 4503599627370476

The EIP states: 9,223,372,036,854,775,771 (MAX_CHAIN_ID). This value is floor(MAX_UINT64 / 2) - 36,, which will have issues 


I added details here https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/2294#issuecomment-1297145918)

author: plasmapower
content: At Arbitrum we initially tried to use a hash function to produce the L2 chain id (it'd make a lot of sense for it to be the hash of the L1 chain id and rollup contract address for instance) but we ran into a lot of tooling problems. I don't remember the details but I think Ledger (the hardware wallet) had a small chain id limit that made it not work with some early testnets.
